Class Categories

Categories class is used to manage a list of Category objects.

Inheritance
System.Object
Categories
Inherited Members
System.Object.ToString()
System.Object.Equals(System.Object)
System.Object.Equals(System.Object, System.Object)
System.Object.ReferenceEquals(System.Object, System.Object)
System.Object.GetHashCode()
System.Object.GetType()
System.Object.MemberwiseClone()
Namespace: Budget
Assembly: HomeBudget.dll
Syntax
public class Categories

Constructors

Categories()

Default constructor that calls the SetCategoriesToDefaults() method to add categories to a list.

Declaration
public Categories()

Properties

DirName

Property to store and access the directory name.

Declaration
public string DirName { get; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.String

The DirName property represents the name of the directory.

FileName

Property to store and access the file name.

Declaration
public string FileName { get; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.String

The FileName property represents the name of the file.

Methods

Add(String, Category.CategoryType)

Adds a new Category in the list of Category. The id number is generated by default.

Declaration
public void Add(string desc, Category.CategoryType type)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String desc

The description of the category.
Category.CategoryType type

The type of the Category
Examples

The example shown below shows the usage of this method: 

Categories c = new Categories();

//Adds a new Category object to the list of Category.
c.Add("Car", Category.CategoryType.Expense);

//Loops through the list of Category that was populated by the constructor and that had a category added to it. 
//Also outputs the description of each category to the console.
foreach (Category category in c.List()){
    Console.WriteLine(category.description);
}

Delete(Int32)

Deletes the Category that matches the id given in the parameter.

Declaration
public void Delete(int Id)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Int32 Id

The id number of the category that needs to be deleted.
Examples

The example shown below shows the usage of this method: 

Categories c = new Categories();

//Removes a Category object from the list of Category.
c.Delete(1);

//Loops through the list of Category that was populated by the constructor by default and that had a category removed from it.
//Also outputs the description of each category to the console.
foreach (Category category in c.List()){
    Console.WriteLine(category.description);
}

GetCategoryFromId(Int32)

Searches for a category of a specific ID and returns the category of that id. This method is used to get info about a category according to its ID and this is possible by searching for an element that matches the ID and returns the first occurrence of the match. Before calling this method, it is necessary to already have a category list from which the id must match.

Declaration
public Category GetCategoryFromId(int i)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Int32 i

The number of the ID of the category to find
Returns
Type Description
Category

The first occurence of a matching ID number
Exceptions
Type Condition
System.Exception

Thrown when the ID number given in the parameter cannot be found from the list of categories

List()

Returns a list of Categories that contains Category objects.

Declaration
public List<Category> List()
Returns
Type Description
System.Collections.Generic.List<Category>

A list of Categories.
Examples

The example shown below shows the usage of this method: 

Categories c = new Categories();

//Loops through the list of Category that was populated by the constructor and outputs the description of each category to the console.
foreach (Category category in c.List()){
    Console.WriteLine(category.description);
}

ReadFromFile(String)

Reads from a file if it exists and populates the categories accordingly. This method is used to stores values for properties of Category by reading its values from a file. This is possible with a method which makes the file an XML document to be able to read and add data to the Category properties. This method will also save the directory and file name for later usage. The file path, if any, needs to be valid in order to read from it.

Declaration
public void ReadFromFile(string filepath = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String filepath

The file path from which the method will read from. If it is not provided (null), its value will be set by default.
Examples

The example shown below shows the usage of this method: 

Categories c = new Categories();


//Calls method to read from filepath and store data in the categories property.
c.ReadFromFile(String filepath);

//Loops through the list of Category that was populated by the previous method and outputs the description of each category to the console.
foreach (Category category in c.List()){
    Console.WriteLine(category.description);
}
Exceptions
Type Condition
System.IO.FileNotFoundException

Thrown when FilePath does not exist. Exception in VerifyReadFromFileName(String, String) method
System.Exception

thrown when there was an error reading from the XML file.

SaveToFile(String)

Saves the Category objects and properties by writing them to a file. This method is used to save the Category objects from a list to a file. This is possible by evaluating every Category object properties from a list and writing them to a XML file. It is necessary for the file path, if any, given in the parameter to be valid in order to write to it. Also, the Category list should not be empty since no data will be saved in the file.

Declaration
public void SaveToFile(string filepath = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String filepath

The file path from which the method will write to. If it is not provided (null), its value will be set by default.
Examples

The example shown below shows the usage of this method: 

Categories c = new Categories();

//Calls method to write to file in filepath.
c.SaveToFile(String filepath);

//Calls method to read from filepath and store data in the categories property to be able to see the output gotten from the previous method.
c.ReadFromFile(String filepath);

//Loops through the list of Category that was populated by the previous method and outputs the description of each category to the console.
foreach (Category category in c.List()){
    Console.WriteLine(category.description);
}
Exceptions
Type Condition
System.Exception

Thrown when FilePath does not exist or when FilePath is read-only meaning that you cannot write in the file. Exception in VerifyWriteToFileName(String, String) method.

SetCategoriesToDefaults()

Sets the Category list to default by adding some Category objects to it. This is used to populate the Category list and it is possible to do so by adding each object to the list with the method Budget.Categories.Add(Budget.Category).

Declaration
public void SetCategoriesToDefaults()
Examples

The example shown below shows the usage of this method: 

Categories c = new Categories();

//Loops through the list of Category that was populated by the constructor by default. 
//Also outputs the description of each category to the console.
foreach (Category category in c.List()){
    Console.WriteLine(category.description);
}
